oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Camelina success story
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Laurinen, Jaakko
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Camelina sativa is an ancient oilseed crop, which has been cultivated in Europe during the iron and bronze ages. The seeds contain about 40 % oil. Camelina oil has an excellent fatty acid composition: 40 % omega-3 fatty acids and 16 % omega-6 fatty acids.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Laurinen, Jaakko (2007) Camelina success story. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 3 (1), p. 30.
